Ich kann meine mails nicht mehr lesen/beantworten VIELEN DANK

HILFE HILFE HILFE

Impossibile scrivere il messaggio nella cartella di posta. Controllare di possedere i permessi di scrittura nel file system e di avere spazio sufficiente per copiare la cartella di posta.

Ne ho assoluta necessita' . Grazie mille

p.s.: ho tanto spazio in memoria

title: Cannot log into Outlook, OAuth2 enabled, Appears to be IP addr related
creator: nz_flyboy1
content: Im running Thunderbird and can no longer log into my Outlook.com email. I have the OAuth2 server protocol enabled and its been working fine for ages, but over the last week or so has increasingly failed to login. It finds the server but hangs on login, finally after a minute or so returning "Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com". I have not made any changes to the settings. Logging into Outlook via my web browser works fine. And here's the weird thing- enabling my VPN to change my IP to another nearby OR disconnecting from my wifi and instead hot-spotting from my 4G mobile phone, which also changes the IP- the login works fine again. Seems Microsoft have for some reason blocked my Thunderbird login at my home IP from their server end- a Real pain in the ass. I cannot find any info what to do online- how to reconfigure Thunderbird or contact Microsoft. Help!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

content:

title: Earthlink email not downloading to my laptop
creator: mennoted
content:
This morning I received no emails from Earthlink. I haven't changed any settings, and my two laptops were receiving emails yesterday.

I went to the Earthlink webmail and the messages were there. Server name is pop.earthlink.net.

I went to the webmail and selected all the emails for this date and marked them as unread, but no joy. :(

I can read my Earthlink emails from the webmail, but sure would like to find them in my inbox!

Thanks for any help.

title: in 139.0.2 how to make messages use only one line of display - How to selectively download mail from various accounts
creator: bob366
content:
Hello Smarter Guys Than I Am:

I just fired up 139.0.2 and I'm seeing something wasteful of space.

Under 128 (see the attachment), I see one line containing all I need to know about an incoming message.

However in 139 I'm seeing a series of "boxes" instead. This wastes space and clutters my display.

Another question: Under 128 you could right click the little Cloud icon and SELECT which email account you wanted to download mail for. Now the cloud won't do that. Instead it downloads all mail for all accounts (I have three), which is sometimes NOT what I want.

I've drilled down into settings, but it's got to be something I have missed. Your collective expertise would be most valuable.

Sincerely, Bob

"Sending of the message failed.

title: Thunderbird Unified Inbox
creator: david548
content: After purchasing a new computer and installing the latest version of Thunderbird, when I use the unified inbox, all messages are displayed twice. They are the same message and if I delete one both disappear. I currently have version 139.0.2 (64-bit). My older laptop has version 128.11.1esr (64-bit) and did not suffer from this problem. As far as I can tell, I have everything configured exactly the same on both laptops.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: sending email fails
creator: dlcict
content:
It has been awhile sense I have donated and I hope this is not a problem but for some reason I can't send email anymore. This started when I attached a couple of pdf documents. Thinking they were to large I kept reducing the size and ultimately trying individual images still with no luck. Finally I tried to send a plain text email and found that too was impossible. I can still receive however, any suggestions?

<redacted>@clemmer.org
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Unable to connect to more than 2 Gmail accounts in Thunderbird
creator: akoutes
content: I have recently updated my PC and I have re-installed Thunderbird. However, Thunderbird will not allow more than 2 GMail accounts to be set-up. I get Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username pr password. It is a gmail account, so the system automatically recognizes it. I have made double and triple sure that the user email and password is correct. I have even made my password smaller to ensure it is not the length of my password that Thunderbird has a problem with. Furthermore I have made sure that the outgoing server label is also unique. Despite all that, I am still unable to add a third Gmail account. Can you please help
metadata: ;solver_id:6829745;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Upgraded Thunderbird to latest and lost all my local emails...thousands! I need them back!
creator: fun4foodie
content: I just recently upgraded to the latest Thunderbird version and now the local folders I created that had thousands of old emails that I need for my business are all missing...gone...they folders now show as empty! Gone! When I do a global search the email snippets show up as if they are there, but when I click it on, says folder empty. I am trying to stay calm and not break down, but I need these back and I don't know what to do. Please help me find these and get them back. They were from 2008 to 2018. Thank you. I am on a Windows computer on Windows 11.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/137.0.0.0

title: POP configuration - file corruption (the huge one with no extension and texts of e-mails)
creator: JonathanWexler
content:
I suspect there is no fix and I (possibly) can restore from backups, but I would sure like to know what the issue is.

I tried retrieving an e-mail from the "folder" where I kept e-mails from 2023. The "index" one sees displayed for the folder had e-mails from Jan-Mar of 2023, but Thunderbird froze when I tried to open any of them. I tried the repair function (which I imagine is meant to rebuild the .msf file), but after than the index contained nothing from Jan-Mar. I opened both the .msf file and the no-extension file in Notepad, but I see nothing from those months.

Any clues/help would be appreciated.
metadata: ;solver_id:1145109;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0
